meanings.definition: A game in which one team prevents the opposing team from scoring any points.
meanings.sent1: The baseball pitcher achieved a shutout by not allowing any runs from the opposing team.
meanings.sent2: The soccer goalkeeper celebrated the shutout victory with his team.
meanings.sent3: During the shutout match, the fans cheered loudly for the home team's defense.
meanings.sent4: The shutout in the final game secured their championship title.
meanings.sent5: The shutout performance of the goalie was crucial for the team's success.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone or something from entering or leaving a place.
meanings.sent1: Please shutout the door to keep the cold air from coming in.
meanings.sent2: The security guard had to shutout unauthorized personnel from entering the building.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally shutout my keys and got locked out of the house.
meanings.sent4: The heavy snowstorm shutout the town, making travel impossible.
meanings.sent5: She had to shutout the noise by closing the windows tightly.

meanings.definition: To exclude someone or something from consideration or participation.
meanings.sent1: The strict eligibility criteria shutout many applicants from the scholarship.
meanings.sent2: The new policy unintentionally shutout certain employees from the decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: His forgetfulness often led to being shutout of important meetings.
meanings.sent4: The exclusive club shutout individuals who did not meet their membership requirements.
meanings.sent5: The team captain decided to shutout the idea of changing their winning strategy.
